EmailTemplate.name: EMEA_Webinar_How_to_Configure_Kubernetes_for_Enterprise_Workloads_Q119.Invite Em
EmailTemplate.subject: [WEBINAR] How to Configure Kubernetes for Enterprise Workloads
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
Please join us on April 30 for the How to Configure Kubernetes for Enterprise Workloads <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/apr-30-how-to-configure-kubernetes-for-enterprise-workloads-webinar?utm_source=e1-invite-promo-link-1&utm_medium=webinar&utm_campaign=kubernetes-pcf]]> webinar. To set your platform up for success, it is important to understand how the configuration of Kubernetes clusters and your workloads interact.
In this webinar, we'll explore:
- What you need to think about before you configure your clusters and how Pivotal Container Service (PKS) can help - How to configure your clusters for different types of workloads - How to deploy those workloads so that they survive Kubernetes lifecycle events - How to keep your workloads up and running to manage upgrades
Presenters: Sinead Kelly, Product Manager at Pivotal Alex Guedes, Platform Architect at Pivotal
Date: Thursday, April 30, 2019 Time: 9:30am GMT/ 10:00am CET
Reserve your seat now.
Attend <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/apr-30-how-to-configure-kubernetes-for-enterprise-workloads-webinar?utm_source=e1-invite-promo-link-2&utm_medium=webinar&utm_campaign=kubernetes-pcf]]>
We thank you in advance for joining us. The Pivotal Team
© 2019 Pivotal Software, Inc. 875 Howard Street <[[https://www.google.com/maps?q=875+Howard+Street&entry=gmail&source=g]]>, Fifth Floor, San Francisco, CA 94103. Published in the USA. Unsubscribe <[[http://info.pivotal.io/c000200I0NAU0rCJC001O00]]>. Manage your subscription preferences <[[http://info.pivotal.io/TDAIO000r0000U220N00CJ0]]>.
